funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship for international students. Türkiye Scholarships is a comprehensive program offering students everything at once!
covered_expenses: monthly stipend up to 9000 TL per month

timeline_info.application_deadline: February 20, 2025 (for 2025-2026 cycle); typically falls between January and February annually
timeline_info.opening_date: January 10, 2025 (for 2025-2026 cycle); expected January 2026 for 2026 intake
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Around 5,000 new scholarships awarded each year (over 5,000 scholarships this year)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Awarded to outstanding international students from all nationalities to pursue full-time or short-term programs at Turkish universities. Eligibility criteria may vary depending on the level of study and specific scholarship category.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Engineering, Social Sciences, Health Sciences, Basic Sciences, Performing Arts, Music, Fine Arts, International Relations, Field Studies, Islamic Theology, Journalism, Landscape Design, Languages, Linguistics, Manufacturing Engineering and Technology, Humanities, Natural Sciences.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Undergraduate applicants typically need a minimum GPA of 70%; postgraduate and doctoral candidates may require 75% or higher.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Associate, Undergraduate, Master's, Doctoral (PhD), Research levels, Short-term programs.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: TOEFL IBT (75, or 70 for some programs), IELTS, SAT, TOEFL PBT, YDS. DET is not accepted.

additional_requirements.career_plan: Compelling statement of purpose articulating academic and career aspirations.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Maximum age 21 for undergraduate programs; under 30 for master's programs; under 35 for PhD programs; under 50 for Research Scholarship.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Individuals currently enrolled in programs in Turkish universities at the level of education they will apply are generally not eligible for full-time scholarships.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Maintaining a high GPA is one of the key eligibility factors, especially for competitive majors like medicine and engineering.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: CNIC/Passport, Letter of Recommendation. Applicants need to ensure documents are up-to-date and accurate.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Değerlendirme ve Seçim Süreci. Interviews are usually held at Turkish embassies or consulates in each applicant’s home country.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: One of the most prestigious educational funding programs globally. Highly competitive, with over 250,000 applications submitted last year (2024/2025 cycle) and an acceptance rate around 2-5%.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The Türkiye scholarship deadline varies annually but typically falls between January and February for most programs. Timeliness is non-negotiable.

covered_expenses: economy class air-ticket to Brunei Darussalam from the scholarship recipient’s country of origin/ country of domicile prior to the commencement of the course and an economy class air-ticket from Brunei Darussalam to the scholarship recipient’s country of origin/country of domicile upon completion of the course

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students/foreign students. Upon completion of the program, the scholarship recipient will be required to leave Brunei Darussalam with immediate effect. A scholarship recipient is not permitted to undertake any paid employment or to serve on the staff of any country's representative mission in Brunei Darussalam during the duration of the scholarship. International students studying/who have studied in Brunei tertiary institutions are NOT eligible.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Various disciplines, different fields of study including engineering, science, humanities.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum qualification of Five (5) Distinctions (As & Bs) in the Senior (for undergraduate). Bachelor's degree with a minimum of Second-Class Honours (Upper Division) (for Master's). Applicants must meet the minimum qualification set by the University for Admission to graduate studies, including a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Diploma, Undergraduate Degree and Postgraduate Master’s Degree level.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proficiency in English is required (minimum IELTS 6.0 or TOEFL 550).

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants applying to Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD) must also complete an online application through UBD's admission portal.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online Application Form (BDGS Application Form), Identification card, Certified academic certificates, Statement of Purpose, Reference Letter.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Government of Brunei Darussalam Scholarship is a prestigious, fully funded award for international students to pursue Diploma, Undergraduate, and Postgraduate Master’s Degree programs at leading institutions in Brunei Darussalam (Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD), Universiti Islam Sultan Sharif Ali (UNISSA), Universiti Teknologi Brunei (UTB), Kolej Universiti Perguruan Ugama Seri Begawan (KUPU SB) and Politeknik Brunei (PB)) for the 2025/2026 academic session. It is offered annually under a special scholarship award scheme by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to foster global understanding.

basic_info.official_name: The Graduate Scholarship Program for ASEAN or Non-ASEAN Countries

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded Scholarships by Thai Government are available to all excellent students to pursue a Master's Degree or PhD Degree from Chulalongkorn University. The scholarship offers full financial support, including tuition fees, a monthly stipend of 16,000 Baht for living expenses and accommodation, and round-trip economy class airfare.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from ASEAN and Non-ASEAN countries. Applicants must not have been studying in any program at Chulalongkorn University for more than one semester. Candidates from all around the world are eligible. Applicants must not be over 35 years of age.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Not lower than 2.75 for undergraduate studies (for Master's applicants) and not lower than 3.25 for graduate studies (for PhD applicants).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Hold an Undergraduate degree for a Master's program or a Master's degree for a PhD program.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Strong command of English must be demonstrated, either by a certificate of English proficiency from the applicant’s prior university or by results on standardised tests like the TOEFL or IELTS. Minimum TOEFL score of 500 (or 173 computer-based).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters from the Head, the Director or the Dean.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Study plan / description of academic interests (on a separate sheet of A4-sized paper).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Students who have been studying in any program at Chulalongkorn University for more than one semester are not eligible to apply for this scholarship.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: No application fee. Recipients are not allowed to accept any off-campus employment in Thailand during the term of the scholarships. The term of the scholarships cannot be extended. Recipients must reside in Thailand.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed application form, relevant documents, Curriculum Vitae, Copy of Certificate of Graduation and an official transcript of academic records, English proficiency score record, Copy of passport, Study plan / description of academic interests, One 1-inch-colored photo (with blue background) taken no more than six months in polite attire, Two recommendation letters.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants must be screened and recruited by the Faculty/Programme of their choice before their names are forwarded to the Office of Academic Affairs, Chulalongkorn University.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Chulalongkorn University, Thailand’s oldest and most prestigious university (established 26 March 1917), offers this Fully Funded Graduate Scholarship Program for international students from ASEAN and Non-ASEAN countries to pursue Master's and Doctoral degrees. The program aims to provide financial assistance for higher graduate studies and foster academic cooperation between Thailand and foreign countries.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applicants must send the completed application form and relevant documents directly to the Faculty/Program of their choice before the deadline set by the University’s Office of Academic Affairs. Applicants should send their application form and relevant documents to the Faculty/Program of their choice at least 2 weeks prior to the deadline set by the University’s Office of Academic Affairs.

basic_info.provider: Hungarian Government, managed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade and coordinated by Tempus Public Foundation

funding_info.funding_details: Tuition-free education. Monthly stipend: HUF 43,700 (~EUR 103) for preparatory, bachelor's, and master's programmes. For doctoral level: HUF 140,000 (cca EUR 365-390) for the first 4 semesters, and HUF 180,000 (cca EUR 470-500) for the second 4 semesters, paid for 12 months a year until completion. Accommodation: Free dormitory place or a contribution of HUF 40,000/month. Medical insurance: Supplementary medical insurance up to HUF 65,000 (~EUR 160) annually.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: More than 4900 students for the academic year 2020/2021

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: The scholarship is for foreign students and is based on bilateral educational agreements between Hungary and specific Sending Partner countries. Applicants must apply through their country's Sending Partner. Eligibility for scholarship types and study fields is determined by these agreements. Current self-financed students in Hungarian Higher Education Institutions applying for the same study level are only eligible under specific conditions. A 'Students at Risk Subprogramme' is also available. For continued state-funded support, scholarship holders must have successfully completed at least their first semester of studies and demonstrated high academic performance (a minimum GPA of 4 (Good) under Hungary’s 5-point grading system). Pakistani nationals must submit a bond to HEC not to change discipline after final award and return to Pakistan to serve the country.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Agricultural Sciences, Arts and Humanities, Social Science, Computer Science and Information Technology, Legal Science, Economic Science, Engineering Science, Medical and Health Science, Sport Science, Natural Science, Arts, Art Education, Political Science and Public Governance (for full degree master studies for SEGIB member states). ELTE offers programs in Education Sciences and Psychology, Humanities, Informatics, Science, Social Sciences, Primary and Pre-School Education, and Business.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants are eligible to apply only for scholarship types and study fields that are determined in the educational cooperation programmes in effect between Hungary and the specific Sending Partner.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 4 (Good) under Hungary’s 5-point grading system for continued state-funded support. A minimum of 56 points (on a 100 points scale) is required to achieve an 'acceptable' or 'conditionally acceptable' application status.
academic_requirements.required_degree: For Bachelor's (Undergraduate) and One-Tier programs: HSSC/Intermediate or equivalent. For Master's (Postgraduate Program): 16 years Bachelor's degree or equivalent. For PhD program: 17/18 years Degree/or equivalent. Final degree and transcript must be submitted before August 01, 2025.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Scientific or technological research production (e.g., published articles, book chapters, book authorship, publications in event annals, coordination of research/extension projects) is valued for doctoral applications (e.g., for Brazil PhD applicants).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS overall band score 5.0 or higher (valid for 2 years). Other accepted tests include IELTS 5-6.5; TOEFL iBT 87-109; TOEIC Listening and Reading 785; TOEIC Speaking and Writing 310; Michigan ECCE; PTE General Level 3; PTE Academic 59. For Brazil PhD applicants, TOEFL IBT, TOEFL ITP, IELTS, or Cambridge Certificate are required. Proof that the previous level of studies was conducted in the language of the selected study programme can also be uploaded.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation from employer or former dean/professor. Letter of recommendation/support from a professor of the host Hungarian institution.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Letter of Intent. Research Plan (minimum 2 pages, typed in Times New Roman 12 point font, in the language of the selected study programme) for PhD applicants. A well-crafted personal essay/motivation letter is important.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Applicants should be the age of 18 by the commencement of studies, by 31 August of 2025 at the latest.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: All documents not in the language of the selected study programme or Hungarian must be translated and submitted with the original copy. A 'Statement of the Supervisor' must be attached to the application by 15 March 2024 if required by the doctoral programme. For partial (exchange) study programmes, a scanned copy of the original certificate about student status issued by the current higher education institution (certifying student status during partial studies) and its translation is required. Pakistani nationals must submit online applications via both the Hungarian and HEC websites.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Scanned copy of original certificate about student status (for partial/exchange programs). Translations of documents not in the study program language or Hungarian. Original master degree certificate or equivalent and its translation (for PhD). Research Plan (for PhD). Updated curriculum vitae (e.g., from Lattes Platform for Brazil PhD). Undergraduate diploma (recognized by MEC for Brazil PhD). Master’s diploma (optional for Brazil PhD). Proficiency test results (TOEFL/IELTS/Cambridge). Letter of Intent. Recommendation from employer or former dean/professor. Letter of recommendation/support from a professor of the host Hungarian institution. Supervisor's statement (if required for PhD). HSSC/Intermediate or equivalent (for Bachelor's/One-Tier). 16 years Bachelor's degree or equivalent (for Master's). 17/18 years Degree/or equivalent (for PhD). Final degree and transcript must be submitted before August 01, 2025.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants are informed about their results by the ministry of education of their country or by the national scholarship office/agency. Key dates include February 2025 for Nomination by Sending Partners and June 2025 for Final Results Announcement. A minimum score of 56 points (on a 100-point scale) is required for an 'acceptable' or 'conditionally acceptable' application status.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Stipendium Hungaricum Scholarship Programme was launched by the Hungarian Government in 2013 to promote the internationalisation of Hungarian higher education and attract top foreign students. It is based on bilateral educational agreements and attracts thousands of applications annually. Currently, 30 Hungarian higher education institutions are engaged in the program.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Online application system expected to open around mid-November 2024. Application Deadline: 15th January 2025. Nomination by Sending Partners: February 2025. Final Results Announcement: June 2025. Start Your Journey in Hungary: September 2025.

basic_info.official_name: Danish Government Scholarship (University of Southern Denmark – SDU)
basic_info.provider: Ministry of Higher Education and Science

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship, granted as full or partial tuition fee waivers. Covers full tuition fees and provides a monthly stipend for living expenses. Monthly Living Expenses Grant of DKK 3000 per month before taxes.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students who are non-EU/EEA citizens and eligible to pay tuition fees. Applicants must be highly qualified and enrolling in specific Master’s degree programs at SDU. Citizen of a developing country. Outstanding international students committed to social impact and leadership. Applicants must first complete and submit the online admission application for their chosen master’s program at SDU; a separate application for the scholarship is not needed. Incomplete or late applications will not be eligible.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s degrees, specifically specific Master’s degree programs, specific Engineering Master’s programs, and Mechatronics Engineering.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Only offered for master’s studies. Scholarships can only be awarded for programmes offered on SDU's campus in Vejle (some sources mention Sønderborg campus).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Strong academic performance; SDU does not publish a minimum GPA, but all SDU education programmes have a grade requirement under quota 1.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Completion of what compares to 180 ECTS credits (i.e. three years of studies) of relevant courses at the university level (equivalent to a Bachelor's degree) for Master's level studies.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency required. TOEFL of min 575/230/88. English B from a Danish High School with a minimum grade of 2.0 on the Danish 7-point grading scale. Admission to English Studies requires English A or equivalent. English as a subject must be passed with a grade equivalent to a minimum of 2.0 on the Danish 7-point grading scale.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation letters from professors or employers who can vouch for abilities and character.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Committed to social impact and leadership.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online admission application for the chosen master’s program.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship acknowledges the important investment that overseas students make during their education. It seeks to assist non-EU/EEA students in their educational pursuits. SDU is described as one of the world’s top 50 universities.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: International students are advised to apply earlier than EU/EEA students to allow enough time (up to three months) to obtain a residence permit.

basic_info.provider: Chinese Scholarship Council (CSC), Chinese Government, Ministry of Education of China, Embassy of the People’s Republic of China

funding_info.funding_details: Annual funding for undergraduates are 59,200 yuan, 62,200 yuan, and 66,200 yuan respectively; master (general scholar) annual. The AASCU-designated Chinese Government Scholarship is valued at approximately 10,000 USD, disbursed to the Chinese universities, not to the individual student.

timeline_info.opening_date: 2026/2027 Chinese Government Scholarship Application Now Open

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be citizens of a country other than the People's Republic of China, and be in good health both mentally and physically. This program is open to all nationalities, though the 'Silk Road' program specifically requires applicants to be nationals of countries that belong to the ‘One Belt One Road’ initiative. Applicants must not have finished their previous study within China or it has been at least a year since they completed their previous study if it was completed in China. Awardees may not concurrently hold overlapping Chinese government-funded scholarships.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Diverse fields such as science, engineering, agriculture, medicine, economics, law. Chinese language programs are also available.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Difficulty finding English-taught programs in some fields (e.g., Gender Studies).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: At least a cumulative GPA of 3.3 on a 4 point scale (80 point GPA on a 100 point scale).
academic_requirements.required_degree: High school diploma (for Bachelor's applicants); Bachelor's degree (16 years) (for Master's applicants); Master's degree (for PhD applicants).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Applicants for master's, doctoral, general scholar, and senior scholar programs taught in Chinese must submit a valid HSK score report that meets the corresponding Chinese language proficiency requirements. For direct entry into Chinese-taught programs, HSK Level 5 or above with a minimum score of 180 is required. For 'Silk Road' program: Bachelor’s applicants need HSK 3(180); Master’s and Ph.D. applicants for Chinese taught programs need HSK 4 (180). Those with minimum HSK but not meeting direct major entry requirements will be given one-year Chinese Language study. No Chinese proficiency requirements for general scholar applicants studying Chinese language programs. HSK winner scholarship available for students with good HSK scores majoring in Chinese language.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation in Chinese or English from professors or associate professors (for graduate programs or senior scholar programs).
additional_requirements.career_plan: Study Plan or Research Proposal in English or Chinese (Undergraduate: Minimum 200 words; Masters: Minimum 800 words; PhD: Minimum 800 words).
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under the age of 35 (for Master's program applicants); Under the age of 40 (for HSK winner scholarship).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants for postgraduate programs or academic education as a general or senior scholar should provide admission documents (admission letter, pre-admission letter, or invitation letter from a prospect supervisor) from the university of preference, which will serve as a priority of admission. Applicants planning to stay in China for more than 6 months must submit a photocopy of the Foreigner Physical Examination Form completed in English. Other application deadlines include: February 25, 2026 (5pm, for email submission to scholarships@dfheris.gov.ie for Ireland applicants); February 28, 2026 (for Youth of Excellence Scheme of China Program Chinese Government Scholarship at Zhejiang University).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Agency Number '5831' is mentioned for one embassy. Applicants should learn about designated Chinese universities and majors they offer, and identify the preferred scholarship program, designated university and major. It is recommended to apply to AASCU recommended Chinese partner universities for the AASCU-designated CGS.

background_and_logistics.official_website: www.campuschina.org, Study in China, Campus China
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed application materials, Application Form for Chinese Government Scholarship, valid HSK score report, two letters of recommendation, copy of the submitted online application, other supporting documentation, pre-admission document issued by the universities applying, photocopy of the Foreigner Physical Examination Form completed in English, Study Plan or Research Proposal.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants learn about designated Chinese universities and majors, identify preferred scholarship program, university, and major. Fill and submit the Application Form online via CGSIS. Some universities may require a separate online application. Scholarship applicants accepted by Chinese institutions will be officially confirmed as Chinese Government Scholarship students with endorsement from the Ministry of Education of China. Admission letters are typically issued in June or July. Admission documents will serve as a priority of admission.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Chinese Government Scholarship (CGS) enables outstanding students, teachers, and scholars from all over the world to study and conduct research in China. It is available for undergraduate, master’s, and PhD studies at more than 280 Chinese universities. It is a full academic-year scholarship.

basic_info.official_name: Government of Ireland – International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES)
basic_info.provider: Government of Ireland, Higher Education Authority (HEA)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded, includes a €10,000 stipend and a full tuition fee waiver for one year of full-time study.
covered_expenses: €10,000 stipend for one year of full-time study
Monthly stipend directed at supporting student costs and living expenses

timeline_info.opening_date: Open for applications for the 2025/26 academic year (2025 call open)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details:
Applicants must:
- Be applying for a Master’s, Postgraduate Diploma, or Doctoral Scholarship (NFQ levels 9 or 10).
- Not currently hold, or have previously held, a Council Postgraduate Scholarship (for research master’s applicants).
- Not currently hold, or have previously held, any Council Postgraduate Scholarship other than those which would enable them to obtain a research master’s degree (for PhD applicants).
- Have a conditional or final offer of admission to an eligible Irish higher education institution at the time of applying.
- Be from non-EU/EEA countries (including non-UK, non-Switzerland domiciliary of origin).
- Not have previously received a GOI-IES scholarship.
- Demonstrate academic excellence, leadership potential, and a commitment to global engagement.
- Have the potential to be future leaders in their field and be committed to making a difference in the world.
- Be citizens from eligible countries (e.g., Nigeria, South Africa, Zambia, Burundi, Namibia, Angola).

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s, Postgraduate Diploma, or PhD (NFQ levels 9 or 10)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English language proficiency is generally required for scholarships in Ireland, often including standardized tests such as IELTS, DET, TOEFL, or PTE.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Personal statements, Statement of Purpose, essays/personal insights, prior experience, carefully prepared application demonstrating academic excellence and alignment with scholarship goals.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic transcripts, recommendation letters, personal statements, Call document, FAQs, Selection Process Infographic, Guidance for Referees, Application Help Document, indicative application form.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications undergo preliminary eligibility checks, then are shared with HEIs for further eligibility checks and shortlisting based on institutional international strategic objectives (e.g., country of origin, study cycle, institutional capacity, field of study). An independent panel of assessors from HEA evaluates shortlisted applications based on call criteria and allocates scores.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A prestigious and highly competitive program supporting high-calibre international students at NFQ levels 9 or 10 (master’s, postgraduate diploma or PhD) in Ireland. It targets students with leadership potential who are committed to making a difference.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open for the 2025/26 academic year.

covered_expenses: Monthly stipend (1,600,000 Colombian pesos for basic living expenses)

timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are currently open for 2025/2026 and 2026/2027 academic years.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Foreign Citizens from all Nationalities (excluding Colombian nationals/citizens or permanent residents of Colombia). High-achieving international students with exceptional academic merit and leadership.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master, Doctoral or Specialization Degree programs in a wide variety of academic disciplines across accredited public and private Colombian Higher Education institutions, in accordance with the 2025-2 ACADEMIC OFFER CATALOG.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Change of academic program or university is not allowed after selection.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 4.0 on the Colombian scale of 1 to 5 (or at least 4 out of 5) in undergraduate degree
academic_requirements.required_degree: Professional or Bachelor’s degree (as prerequisite for postgraduate study). Scholarship is for Master, Doctoral, or Specialization degrees.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional experience in their field of study.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Language requirements mentioned, but no specific tests or scores provided.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recent academic letter of recommendation from a university professor where the applicant finished his/her bachelor degree. Letter must be dated within thirty days of the application date.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Scholarship recipient agrees not to request a visa to remain in Colombia for two (2) years from the date the scholarship ends, and must return to country of origin/residence.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Not residing, nor having resided the last 6 months prior to applying for the scholarship in Colombian territory, or having started studies in Colombia at the time of application. Do not have dual nationality (Colombian). Not been beneficiaries of this program in previous calls. No application fee required. Minimum income equivalent to three minimum wages (approx. 3,480,000 COP or 828 USD in 2024).

background_and_logistics.official_website: Official program bases document: https://web.icetex.gov.co/documents/20122/3121541/bases-de-postulacion-programa-beca-colombia-extranjeros-2025-02-ingles.pdf. Main application portal/website not explicitly provided in scraped content.
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application. Verified copies of Educational Transcripts. University certificate-transcript (English/Spanish) certifying GPA. Academic letter of reference.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Administered by ICETEX, an institution of the Colombian State. Aims to promote Higher Education through granting educational credits and international cooperation scholarships to foreign citizens within the framework of the Strategy of Reciprocity for foreigners. Targets high-achieving international students with exceptional academic merit and leadership.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications open for 2025/2026 and 2026/2027 academic years. Application deadline for 2025-2026 is June 13, 2025. Final selection: June–August 2026. Start of scholarship: Between July 1 – November 1, 2026.

basic_info.provider: Flemish Ministry of Education and Training / Government of Flanders

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. Includes a grant of €10,000 (or €10,020) and a tuition fee waiver per academic year.

timeline_info.application_deadline: University application: January 15, 2026 (for 2026-2027 academic year); Master Mind application form: March 15, 2025 (for 2026-2027 academic year, as per one source)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding international students worldwide to pursue a master’s degree in Flanders and Brussels. Applicants must apply to and be accepted by one of the participating Flemish host universities. Students whose previous degree was obtained at a Flemish higher education institution are not eligible. Students already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution cannot apply. International students who have previously been on credit mobility (e.g., Erasmus+) in a Flemish higher education institution are still eligible.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Eligible Master's degree programmes at participating Flemish host institutions.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Preparatory programmes and distance learning are not eligible.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (to apply for a Master's program)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English language proficiency required: IELTS overall minimum band score of 7.0, or TOEFL minimum total score of 94, or C1 level of the Common European Framework.

application_documents: KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form (if applying to KU Leuven)
Official letter of acceptance from the host university (required before scholarship application)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Host institution nominates eligible students who have expressed interest in the scholarship after the university application deadline. The host institution creates the candidate’s application file in the Mobility-Online tool. Pre-selected candidates receive an email from Mobility-Online.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Exceptional opportunity for outstanding international students to pursue a Master’s degree in Flanders and Brussels, Belgium.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship available for academic years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027.

basic_info.provider: Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship designed to foster international cooperation in cultural, scientific, and technological fields, promote the Italian language and culture, and support Italy’s economic system. Grantees typically receive a monthly stipend of approximately €900, paid quarterly, totaling 9000 euros for a full year. Grants are offered for 9 months (renewable for multi-year courses) or 3 months (exclusively for advanced Italian language and culture courses).
covered_expenses: Exemption from Payment of enrollment and tuition fees

timeline_info.application_deadline: May 16, 2025, by 2:00 PM CET (for the 2025–2026 academic year)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: A fixed number of fully funded scholarships are awarded annually. Specific mentions include a maximum of 9 scholarships/grants for six months (900€ each month), and 9 month-long scholarships (renewable) plus 3 month-long scholarships for language courses.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to foreign citizens living abroad and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Applicants must hold an appropriate academic qualification required to enroll in the Italian University/Institute. Must not be residing in Italy. The grant is incompatible with any other grant offered by the Italian Government or any other Italian public institution, including DSU grants. Excludes Bachelor's degree programs (except AFAM) and Single-cycle degree programs (“Lauree magistrali a ciclo unico”).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s Degree programs, PhD programs, Higher Education in Fine Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) programs, Research under academic supervision, Italian Language and Culture advanced courses, studies and research/training programs.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Bachelor's degree programs (except AFAM), Single-cycle degree programs (“Lauree magistrali a ciclo unico”).

academic_requirements.required_degree: Appropriate academic qualification required to enroll. For Master’s: a relevant bachelor’s degree. For PhD: a master’s degree. Candidates must have finished their prior degree with a strong academic record.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For Italian-taught programs: a certificate proving proficiency in Italian language (minimum B2 CEFR). Candidates enrolled in an Italian language course at the University may submit a language certification issued by a language teacher of the University department. For English-taught programs: a certificate proving proficiency in the English language. For Italian Language and Culture courses: Italian A2 (CEFR).

additional_requirements.career_plan: Applicants are advised to write about personal story, academic interests, study path, and purpose and objectives of their study project.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Applicants for Master’s Degree programmes, Higher Education for Fine Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) programmes or Italian Language and Culture advanced courses must be of age and shall not exceed the age of 28 by the deadline of this Call (born after May 16th 1996), with the sole exception of renewals.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Specific mention of scholarships open exclusively to Palestinian citizens by one source. Age limit has a sole exception for renewals.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: For PhD: required to provide a letter of acceptance on behalf of the relevant Italian University. Selection is based on academic merit, motivation, and knowledge of the Italian or English language. No other Italian government scholarship allowed.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic qualification, Italian/English language proficiency certificate, letter of acceptance (for PhD applicants).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection is based on academic merit, motivation, and knowledge of the Italian or English language, depending on the program requirements. Applicants are instructed to follow application instructions to win the scholarship.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Italian Government Scholarship (MAECI) is an esteemed initiative funded by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI) to support international students in pursuing higher education in Italy. It aims to promote cultural exchange, strengthen academic cooperation, and allow students to experience Italy’s rich academic and cultural heritage.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are for the 2025-2026 academic year. Start Date: From November 1, 2025 (except for language courses, which begin January 1, 2026). 9 month-long scholarships are available from November 1, 2025 to July 31, 2026. 3 month-long scholarships for language courses are available from January 1 to September 30, 2026.

basic_info.provider: Thailand Government, Thailand International Cooperation Agency (TICA)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded master’s scholarships. TIPP provides 100% tuition coverage, monthly living allowances, and research funding. Full funding with stipends for outstanding international candidates.

timeline_info.application_deadline: January 31, 2026 (for TIPP 2026); Deadlines vary by year and nominating country (e.g., January 31, 2025 for TIPP 2025, July 14, 2023 for TIPP 2023 in St. Lucia, May 20, 2022 for TIPP 2022)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 70 postgraduate scholarships (as part of TICA's over 700 training fellowships and postgraduate scholarships)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Candidates must fulfill all requirements. Open to international students from developing countries, often government officials. Allocated for specific member states. Candidates must be nominated by the National Focal Point for International Development Cooperation (e.g., Ministry of Foreign Affairs) or relevant central government agencies for which the nominated candidates currently work. A list of eligible countries/territories is available.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Development topics categorized under six themes: Sufficiency Economy Philosophy (SEP), Public Health, Agriculture and Food Security, Climate Change and Environmental Issues, Bio-Circular-Green Economy (BCG) Model, and other topics related to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Specific programs mentioned include Master of Science in Food Technology, Biomedical Sciences, Nursing Science, Pharmaceutical Sciences and Technology.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience with the nominating agency

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English test score (e.g. TOEFL, IELTS); strict language requirements

additional_requirements.reference_letters: At least 3 recommendation letters from three persons
additional_requirements.age_limits: Recommended no more than 45 years of age. Application requirements and age limits are indicated on the list of Academic Institutions.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Candidates must be government officials from developing countries (for TICA programs including TIPP).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Relevant qualification requirements; relevant current work; Thesis proposal or other documents (as university request).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: TIPP application form (hard copy required), recommendation letters (3), English test score (TOEFL/IELTS), thesis proposal or other documents (as university request).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Candidates are nominated by their National Focal Point for International Development Cooperation or relevant central government agencies. The Focal Point forwards documents to the Royal Thai Embassy/Permanent Mission/Consulate-General, which then sends them to TICA. Application is complete when TICA receives hard copies via the Embassy/Mission/Consulate-General.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Introduced in 2000, TIPP is a framework under Thailand International Development Cooperation (TIDC) aimed at sharing Thailand’s best practices and experience with the world, contributing to sustainable development through postgraduate scholarships for people in other developing countries.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Master's degree programs typically last 2 years, though some sources mention 3 years. Program start/intake is around mid-year (e.g., Mid-2026), with exact month varying by university.

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship offers full and partial funding. First Prize for Master's covers Tuition (30,000 RMB), Living allowance (1,700 RMB/month for 10 months), and Medical Insurance (800 RMB). Second Prize for Master's covers Tuition (30,000 RMB) only. Some sources describe the First Prize as fully funded, covering tuition, stipend, health insurance, and accommodation.

timeline_info.application_deadline: May 31, 2025 (for 2025 intake, specific to Tianjin University)
timeline_info.opening_date: October 15, 2024 (for 2025 intake, specific to Tianjin University)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students (non-Chinese citizens) who are in good physical and mental health. Applicants can be prospective or current international students at eligible universities in Tianjin. Applicants must meet the language requirements of the higher education institutions and provide relevant proofs. For current students, they must be foreign self-funded undergraduate, postgraduate, or PhD students normally enrolled in Tianjin.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: No Limit (for High-level Graduate Student Program, generally applicable)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 or equivalent (or minimum average of 80% for high school applicants).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For Chinese-instructed programs: HSK-5 certificate with a minimum score of 180, or HSK-4 certificate with a minimum score of 180 for programs in the School of International Education. For English-instructed programs: English Proficiency Certificates are required. Some sources claim 'No IELTS' is needed, implying other forms of English proficiency are accepted.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation in Chinese or English from professors or associate professors (for graduate programs).
additional_requirements.career_plan: Personal Statement, including study or research plan (no less than 800 words for Master and Doctor Degree).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must be in good physical and mental health. A deposit of 7,000 RMB and an application fee of 420 RMB may be required (specific to Tianjin University International Student Scholarship, but often linked). Original high school certificates and certified diploma copies are required upon registration for enrollment qualification review.

application_documents: Personal Statement (including study or research plan, personal background, financial situation, personal strengths, etc., no less than 800 words for Master's degree, in Chinese or English)
HSK-5 certificate (minimum score 180) for Chinese-instructed programs
English Proficiency Certificates for English-instructed programs
Two letters of recommendation from professors or associate professors (for graduate programs)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Scholarship list is determined by experts organized by Tianjin Municipal Education Commission. Assessment results are publicized for one week before submission. Admission results are announced officially on the university website, and Admission Notice and Visa Application Form (JW202) are sent to scholarship winners from July 1 to August 31.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: This is a one-year duration scholarship, open to both prospective and current students at Tianjin University, and it can be applied for year by year (renewable).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2025 intake opened October 15, 2024, and closed May 31, 2025. Results are announced between July 1 and August 31.

basic_info.provider: Romanian Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA) and Ministry of Education.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded. Covers tuition, living expenses, and accommodation. Provides a monthly stipend of up to 80 euros. A monthly stipend is also provided for students studying in the Romanian language preparatory year.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 85 scholarships for under- and post-graduate studies (MFA scholarship); 40 fully funded awards (ARICE scholarship)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding students from non-EU countries (with some exceptions for EU candidates). Applicants must have good results in education, with an average of the study years for the last graduated school of at least 7 (seven) corresponding to the scoring system in Romania or a 'Good' score. Must submit all required documents.

field_restrictions.restrictions: Medicine, Dental Medicine, and Pharmacy are excluded.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 7/10 or equivalent, or a 'Good' score.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor’s degree (for graduates of high school studies or pre-university studies with a baccalaureate degree or equivalent), Master’s degree, and PhD programs.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For Bachelor and Master programs, only study programs in Romanian are available. A mandatory preparatory year in Romanian is granted for those not speaking Romanian. PhD students may study in Romanian/English or another language set by the university. Applicants must prove proficiency in the language of instruction (e.g., language certificates like TOEFL, IELTS, DELF, or CEFR for non-Romanian programs) for non-Romanian programs.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two reference letters (for Master's applicants); letters of recommendation.
additional_requirements.career_plan: A motivation letter or statement of purpose explaining the applicant’s reasons for applying to the scholarship program and their academic or career goals.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 35 years old for Bachelor's and Master's programs; under 45 for PhD programs.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must be citizens from non-EU countries (with some exceptions for EU candidates).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application form; required documents with authorized translations into Romanian, English, French, or Spanish. Specific documents include: diplomas, transcripts (including for the final year of studies until application submission), birth certificate, passport, CV (Europass format recommended), motivation letter/statement of purpose, medical certificate, educational certificates (SSC, HSC, Bachelor’s, Master’s, PhD if applicable).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are reviewed by the Romanian Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Selection stages may include document reviews, interviews, or entrance exams.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The annual scholarship program for foreign citizens is offered by the Romanian state through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, based on Government Decision no. 288/1993. It aims to promote education and cultural exchange by offering fully funded opportunities for Bachelor’s, Master’s, and PhD studies at accredited higher education institutions in Romania.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications must be submitted online between 29 January 2025 and 12 March 2025 through the official Study In Romania scholarship platform.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded program, financial assistance offered by the Indonesian Government.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants originating from developing countries; students from developing nations and countries with strong diplomatic ties to Indonesia.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All Academic Fields & Majors, including Sciences, Intelligent Electrical and Informatics Technology, Civil, Planning, Geo-Engineering, Marine Technology, Industrial Technology and Systems Engineering, engineering, economics, health sciences, social studies, and Educational Science Education.

academic_requirements.required_degree: High school degree for Bachelor's program; Bachelor's degree for Master's program; Master's degree for Doctoral program.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work history (if any), professional work experience.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: TOEFL ITP of 500, TOEFL IBT of 61, IELTS of 6.0, TOEIC of 575 (certificate must be obtained within the validity period); English Proficiency Test (for applicants from non-English-Speaking Countries).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation letter from the Indonesian Embassy or the Indonesian Consulate General; Recommendation letter from the potential research supervisor in one of the universities providing partner of the KNB Scholarship (for doctoral applicant only); Recommendation letter from the employer/immediate supervisor (if working); Academic Recommendation Letter from Previous Schools/Universities.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Maximum age 21 years old for Bachelor's degree (no more than December 31st, 2025); Maximum age 40 years old for Master's/Doctoral degree.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Valid passport (with at least 2 years of validity); Formal Photo; Curriculum Vitae; Statement of purpose of their studies in Indonesia (for Doctoral applicant only); Applicants cannot register without a recommendation letter from the Indonesian Representative in the relevant country.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Recommendation letter from Indonesian Embassy/Consulate General; Recommendation letter from potential research supervisor (for Doctoral); Recommendation letter from employer/immediate supervisor (if working); Academic Recommendation Letter from Previous Schools; Valid passport; Academic transcripts; Scanned degree certificate; Formal Photo; Curriculum Vitae; Offering Letter; English Proficiency Test; Academic Certificates from Previous Degree; Statement of purpose of their studies in Indonesia (for Doctoral applicant only).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection results announced online via KNB Scholarship Website and officially through Indonesian Embassy publication network; Indonesian Representatives collect and review documents for Recommendation Letters (educational background, work history, document validity); Monitoring and evaluation processes.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Prestigious scholarship program; Part of Indonesia’s global cooperation efforts (South–South Partnership); Offers quality degree programs managed by 31-34 university partners; Provides an experience of studying in prestigious universities in Indonesia while living in a diverse and vibrant society; Managed by the Directorate General of Higher Education, Ministry of Education and Culture; Access to more than 900 cutting-edge academic programs.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship runs annually, with mentions for AY 2025, 2025-2026, and 2026-2027.

basic_info.official_name: National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic (NSP)
basic_info.provider: Government of Slovakia; Ministry of Education, Science, Research, and Sport of the Slovak Republic; Ministry of Education, Research, Development, and Youth

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. Offers financial support to cover living costs during study/research/teaching/artistic stays. Includes monthly stipend and travel grants. Tuition-free stay.

timeline_info.application_deadline: April 30, 2026 (for 2026-2027 academic year program); October 30/31, 2025 (for summer semester 2026-2027 or earlier calls); April 30, 2025 (for 2025 calls)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 146 (for a specific call); 48 (annually for students from ODA nations)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international nationals (excluding Slovakia) studying or working outside Slovakia. Applicants must be accepted by Slovak host institutions for short-term academic, research, teaching, or artistic stays. Supports Master’s and PhD students, university teachers, researchers, and artists. PhD students must have their higher education or scientific training outside Slovakia and be accepted by a Slovak university or research institution for an academic mobility stay. International applicants should not have studied in Slovakia before, but must be admitted or invited to a local university. Ineligible if: accepted for full degree higher education in Slovakia, already studying full degree in Slovakia and seeking NSP funding, university teachers/researchers/artists without a PhD (or equivalent) and with more than 4 years of work experience, spent 15 or more months in Slovakia within 36 months prior to application deadline, or accepted for a scholarship stay in Slovakia through other public-funded programs (e.g., Erasmus+, CEEPUS).

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's student, PhD student, university teacher, researcher, or artist (for short-term mobility stays)

experience_requirements.min_years: University teachers, researchers, and artists without a PhD degree (or equivalent) and with more than 4 years of work experience are ineligible. PhD studies are considered as work experience.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English (or Slovak) proficiency level required, with relevant certificates if possible (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS). Specific scores mentioned: IELTS 6.0+ / TOEFL iBT 80+. SAT score minimum 1100 also mentioned.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters from professors or supervisors
additional_requirements.career_plan: Detailed study programme or detailed teaching and/or research/artistic programme
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Curriculum vitae, motivation letter, confirmation of current enrollment (for students and PhD candidates), academic transcripts and degree, list of publications/artistic activities (for PhD students), original documents with official translations into Slovak or English.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application form, curriculum vitae, motivation letter, detailed study/research/artistic programme, two recommendation letters, confirmation of current enrollment (students and PhD candidates), academic transcripts and degree, English (or Slovak) proficiency certificates (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS), list of publications/artistic activities (for PhD students), official translations of documents if not in Slovak or English.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in 2005 by the Government of the Slovak Republic to support the mobility of students, PhD students, university teachers, researchers and artists for scholarship stays at higher education institutions and research organizations in Slovakia.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship stays are possible during the summer semester of the academic year 2026/2027.

basic_info.official_name: Azerbaijan Government Scholarship (Educational Grant for OIC/NAM) / Heydar Aliyev—International Education Grant Program
basic_info.provider: Government of Azerbaijan, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Ministry of Science and Education, Azerbaijan International Development Agency

funding_info.funding_details: This is a fully funded scholarship for international students, structured to ensure comprehensive support throughout their educational journey.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Nomination by home country government: May 15, 2025; SIACAS online application (second stage): June 20, 2025; Ugandan applicants: April 30, 2025

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be international students who are citizens of OIC or NAM member countries (from over 150 eligible countries). They must not be citizens of or have terminated citizenship from the Republic of Azerbaijan.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Preparatory courses, Undergraduate, Graduate (Master’s), Doctoral, General Medicine, and Residency programs. Specific fields mentioned include engineering, public health, international relations, and other high-demand fields.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Undergraduate students are advised not to apply for medical-related degree programs in Azerbaijan universities, as they are not recognized by the Sri Lanka Medical Council (SLMC) as of now.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA: 70% (for application); 3.0 (for annual renewal of fellowship)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Language proficiency in English, Russian, Turkish, or Azerbaijani. Specific scores: IELTS 5.5 / TOEFL 50 (for Master’s/PhD).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two Recommendation Letters (from academic or professional referees)
additional_requirements.career_plan: Research Proposal (for Ph.D. applicants), Motivation Letter
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 35 years of age (for undergraduate and general medicine programs). Not over 30 years for Master's/Graduate and 40 years for PhD on or before the deadline.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants must be officially nominated by their respective government authorities (Ministry of Foreign Affairs or Education) in the first stage to proceed to the second stage of the application process.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must possess the required academic background. Applicants with foreign qualifications should have their documents equated by relevant national bodies (e.g., UNEB for undergraduate, NCHE for postgraduate in Uganda).

application_documents: Application letter with a recent passport photograph (for Ugandan applicants)
Photocopies of academic certificates and transcripts (for Ugandan applicants)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: 1. Submission of applications (first stage) to relevant government authorities of the applicant’s country (March 15 - May 15, 2025). 2. Review and evaluation of candidates by respective government authorities (May 16 - May 31, 2025). 3. Registration of applications (second stage) in the SIACAS (Study in Azerbaijan Centralized Admission Service) (June 1 - June 20, 2025). 4. Review and evaluation of candidates (June 20 - July 15, 2025). 5. Notification of selected candidates (July 16 - July 31, 2025).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Azerbaijan Government Scholarship is a distinguished program offering fully funded opportunities for international students from OIC/NAM member countries to pursue undergraduate, master’s, doctoral, and general medicine studies at leading universities in Azerbaijan. Its main goal is to attract international students for university studies and research.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Submission of applications (first stage) to home country authorities: March 15 - May 15, 2025. Review by home country authorities: May 16 - May 31, 2025. SIACAS online registration (second stage): June 1 - June 20, 2025. Review and evaluation of candidates: June 20 - July 15, 2025. Notification of selected candidates: July 16 - July 31, 2025. Start of academic year: September 15, 2025. Last date for arrival in Azerbaijan: September 30, 2025.

basic_info.provider: Australian Government (Commonwealth Department of Education and Training)

funding_info.funding_details: Provides financial support for high-quality higher degree by research candidates, including a living allowance of AUD $33,511 per annum (full-time) paid fortnightly. It is a fully funded scholarship for PhD and Master's by Research degrees.
covered_expenses: Relocation costs (up to A$2,000 at UniSC)

timeline_info.application_deadline: International students for Round 1 (commencing Jan-Mar) at ANU: 31 August. Federation University 2026 RTP stipend scholarships: 31st of [month missing] (11:59 PM).
timeline_info.opening_date: Federation University 2026 RTP stipend scholarships: 1 September 2025.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to both domestic and international students undertaking Research Doctorate and Research Masters degrees (Higher Degree by Research - HDR) at eligible Australian universities. Candidates must be high-quality and may be new applicants or current students (typically enrolled for less than a year full-time equivalent). Domestic students are eligible for a full RTP Fees Offset if they have not used RTP Fees Offset or Research Training Scheme funding in the previous three years or have completed an HDR program. Some universities require full-time, on-campus enrolment for stipend scholarships. Applicants must demonstrate capacity for effective supervisory support. All RTP Scholarship students must be enrolled (without suspension) in a current HDR course. Work commitments are not accepted as grounds for extension. Available to students undertaking Joint Research Awards when Monash University is the home institution. Applicants may need to be nominated by an enrolling school or institute.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Available in all fields of study (UTAS) or aligned with the university's broad areas of expertise/research strategy (ACU, ANU).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Very high academic achievement, often equivalent to a first-class honours bachelor's degree or a relevant Master's degree with very good grades. Some universities mention a minimum GPA of 6.0 or above on a 7-point scale or equivalent. A perfect or very close to perfect GPA is often required.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Research Doctorate, Research Masters, Masters by Research, PhD, or research-focused professional doctorate.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: At least six months of relevant supervised research experience (e.g., as part of a Master's degree) with outstanding results. Research experience deemed equivalent by the university. Research internships are also mentioned.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Meet the University's English language proficiency requirements for enrolment in a research degree.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Strong referee letters, preferably from academics who supervised previous research.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Something to make the applicant stand out (e.g., authorship of a peer-reviewed journal paper, notable academic prizes/commendations). Confirmation of a qualified supervisor, available space, and resources. Research environment considerations. Academic achievement and/or ethic during the most relevant qualification.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Required documents as specified by the chosen university's 'How to Apply' webpage. May include a 'Request for a current ANU student to be considered for a HDR Scholarship form' or an 'online graduate research application for Scholarship Only'.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Universities are responsible for their own application, selection, and offer processes. Eligible applicants may be automatically considered for scholarships when applying for course admission. Selection is based on competitive ranking, academic merit, academic results for prior study, research potential, and alignment with university research strategy. Requires meeting merit-based selection criteria and confirmation of supervisor/resources. Applicants are encouraged to contact their chosen university's postgraduate research office directly.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The RTP is the principal Commonwealth Government program supporting promising researchers. Scholarships are available for a minimum of 3 years and up to a maximum of 4 years full-time for a research doctorate, or 6-8 years part-time. For a Research Masters degree, the duration is 2 years full-time. The period of support can be increased for approved leave. If changing from doctoral to masters, support is limited to a maximum of two years full-time equivalent including time already spent. It is one of the most prominent and competitive funding options.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application periods vary by university, typically once or twice a year. Round 1 commencements are usually from January to March of the following year.

funding_info.funding_details: Covers tuition fees fully or partially, and needs to be applied for every year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants for Bachelor, Master's, and Doctoral Degrees in Chinese universities and colleges in the Beijing region. Scholarship duration should be under 4 years. Applicants must already be admitted as an undergraduate or graduate student at a Beijing university (e.g., PKU, BNU) and not be receiving other tuition scholarship funds. Previous degree should preferably be from a prestigious university with an average score of at least 80/100 or a GPA of 3.0. For current students, the average score of the previous academic year must be no less than 80/100.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: at least 80/100 or a GPA of 3.0

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For English-taught majors: IELTS 6.0, TOEFL 75 or above, or proof of language proficiency at the corresponding level. Applicants from countries whose official language is English applying for English-taught majors do not need to provide proof of English proficiency. For Chinese-taught postgraduate programs: HSK-5 level or above. Students applying for English-taught programs do not need to submit Chinese proficiency test scores at the time of application.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Receiving no other tuition scholarship funds

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application Form for Beijing Government Scholarship (obtained from the Higher Education Institutions or downloaded from the website of the targeted HEIs).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) will assess all applications and send the Scholarship Admission Notice, Admission Notice and Visa Application Form for Study in China (JW201) to candidates three months before the study begins. The International students’ office at specific universities (e.g., PKU) is authorized to be responsible for acceptance, review, and approval of applications.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established by Beijing Municipal Government to encourage and support outstanding international students to study and conduct research in the capital city. Covers tuition fees fully or partially, and needs to be applied for every year. Available for Bachelor, Master's, and Doctoral degrees.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship duration for Bachelor, Master's, and Doctoral degrees is under 4 years.
